results.title: Employment interview
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Moray Foutz and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
The importance of the employment interview in getting the right person on the job. A brief review of poor hiring methods is given to illustrate how good workers can be overlooked in favour of less qualified, more aggressive, workers when those who do the hiring are untrained or indifferent. The film then illustrates a good interview, step by step; obtaining information through application forms and friendly discussion, testing, use of rating scale, etc. The function of foreman and supervisors in the interview is discussed, and pre-induction preparation of the applicant hired is shown.

results.title: The Emperor's oblong pancake. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Fine Arts and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An animated version of the story by Peter Hughes about the emperor who tried to change all the round objects in his kingdom into oblong ones. Narrated by Edward Everett Horton. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used in telling the Hans Andersen tale about the tailor who deceives a vain king and his court, and is eventually exposed by a candid child who sees that the king is not actually wearing any clothes at all.

results.title: Emotional maturity
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
A docu-drama depicting the immature behaviour of an adolescent boy who fails to channel his emotions into positive feelings and actions. After being rejected by his girlfriend, Dave seeks revenge by slashing her new boyfriend’s tyres. Deeper investigation suggests that Dave’s parents have contributed to his ‘emotional instability’ by treating him like a child.

results.title: Emotional aspects of pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Sally Marschall, Phillip Koch and Joshua Productions
results.brief_description: Prepares the expectant mother and father for emotional changes, highlighting the experiences of two expectant couples and of one single expectant mother. During pregnancy, the woman’s feelings become more intense. The man’s feelings change also. Relationships with family and friends take on new dimensions. Both need reassurance that they are loved.

results.title: Breathing for others
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films

results.title: Medical self-help: emergency childbirth
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare
results.brief_description: Teaches the individual how to take care of his medical and health needs in time of disaster when medical assistance might not be readily available. Presents instructions on emergency childbirth at home. Uses animated drawings.

results.title: Emergency bridge - Hutt Gully
results.brief_description: Shows the step-by-step erection of a Bailey bridge by the Country Roads Board over a washaway on the Great Ocean Road, Victoria. In twelve hours, over 11 inches of rain had fallen, causing a gully 110 feet wide and 50 feet deep, thus completely stopping traffic. Twelve hours later traffic was flowing across a prefabricated bridge built by the Board as a temporary measure.
